website_summaries.verdict: High-tech sugar disposal at a friendly price point. A single button controls the sugar flow.
pros: This sugar dispenser is equipped for the 21st century
Control your sugar intake with the press of a button
cons: The amount of pressure placed on the button will impact the flow of sugar

customer_reviews.title: I love the design of this
customer_reviews.text: A sweet Warehouse Deal on my favourite mid-century-modern-looking sugar dispenser. This is my second one. It's tall and narrow, and takes up a very small footprint in the cupboard. As for its function, this item does dispense consistent teaspoon-sized servings of powder or granules. I use it for sugar and Splenda, but it could be also used for cocoa powder, matcha, or spices.
customer_reviews.author: MMMM

customer_reviews.title: Opening for refill can be improved to accommodate all types of sugar
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of this sugar dispenser. Sleek and modern looking. Could be improved gouge. I use it mainly for coconut sugar as it's the only type of sugar we have in the house. It's really hard to fill it due to the slightly bigger particles of coconut sugar and the higher humidity. It would be nice to have a wider opening for the refill. I do love that it let out little quantity of sugar at a time, my daughter loves to use it on her pancake and oatmeal and just one or 2 pushes is all what she needs. No waste
customer_reviews.author: Lance P. Moore

customer_reviews.title: More for visual
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t handle raw brown sugar I had to blend it to powder in order to use dispenser
customer_reviews.author: VeryClaire

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love it. This is my third one. Bye accident. My kids broke the first two.it is easy to use and to refill. The only thing I don't like is that, sometimes the bottom lid has sugar residues when you open it
customer_reviews.author: Maritza Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Part missing
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to come with refill funnel . Didn’t ! Must turn over to refill.save your money
customer_reviews.author: Neil Gingold

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I had the first one for many many years. When it broke I was so relieved to find this replacement. This is a great product and I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: MARY HINTON

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I think what bothered the folks that used this at my house was that they like full teaspoons of sugar and this dispenses in halves. They felt like they were pressing the button over and over to get the sugar. I personally think that's a little silly and that it's still a novel idea. BUT, that being said, it doesn't hold much sugar so you are refilling it much more often than you'd like. It's all there but a little tweaking would make it all there and then some.
customer_reviews.author: K8EKISS

customer_reviews.title: No  funnel in base (as advertised). Hard to pour sugar in container. Product is not quality.
customer_reviews.text: On the box, and in advertisement, the product claimed it had a small funnel in the base to help with pouring sugar in the very small areas of the dispensor. The product I received did not have that, and was not able to open it.
customer_reviews.author: Josey

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work, I press the button and most of the time the sugar doesn't come out
customer_reviews.author: patricia nader

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this sugar dispenser. It works very well and always becomes a subject of conversation when we have new guests over.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: Ehhh. I use monk fruit sweetener .. didn’t work for me ..
customer_reviews.author: Maria C

customer_reviews.title: A Real "Sweet" product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a number of months ago and I LOVE it. It's a great product to have if you have kids in the house. It gives them the freedom to sweeten their food on their own with minimal mess. And it provides portion control so they don't go crazy with adding to much sugar. Overall a great product. Easy to fill, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for salt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to cook with, but we use it for salt. It is great to dispense into a dish one-handed. After reading the other reviews, I do not know how accurate it measures, but have never noticed it measuring "short." We have never had a problem with it clogging and have been using it for several years.
customer_reviews.author: RCmomma

customer_reviews.title: Great Sugar Dispenser
customer_reviews.text: The sugar dispenser is a great way to keep sugar dry and free from clumps. It looks good and I just keep it near the coffee pot. Doesn's take up a lot of space and the sugar doesn't leak out because of a cap that you keep on before and after use. Great product. Going to buy one for coffee creamer.
customer_reviews.author: JeanieK

customer_reviews.title: Not practical for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: While it is a sleek looking dispenser, it is not something I would recommend someone else to use as an every day sugar dispenser. It does not hold a good amount of sugar, so it must be refilled very often. And the refilling is my biggest issue with the product. It is almost impossible to refill without spilling sugar everywhere. I am a very careful person, but the refill opening is extremely small and you basically need a funnel to refill it properly without making a mess. And on top of that it does not function very well. It sticks often and sugar leaks out of the bottom every time you pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: We really like this sugar dispenser
customer_reviews.text: We were given one of these sugar dispenser for a gift and now we just bought two more to give out as gifts. We love it, however, I couldn't give it an actual five stars as we do have some problems with the sugar leaking out a little and being somewhat messy. However, it is great to keep the children from using too much sugar. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Garry

customer_reviews.title: I think the manufacturers or sellers give the impression that each press of the button releases a teaspoonful--think it's more l
customer_reviews.text: Wish it held a little more--also, I think the manufacturers or sellers give the impression that each press of the button releases a teaspoonful--think it's more like a half.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Richter

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased With Sugar Please
customer_reviews.text: It took a little getting use to, but once I realized that a teaspoon took three presses instead of two, I was very satisfied with this little gadget. I had purchased two, one for sugar and one for Splenda. It would be nice if they could make these in different colors.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: so cool
customer_reviews.text: I don't use sugar myself but my friends do. When they come over for coffee and I give them my sugar dispenser they love it. It gives the appropriate amount of sugar and No more wet spoon in the sugar bowl..:)
customer_reviews.author: Sammie

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this for sugar, doesn't work well with creamer. The built in funnel is a really nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey.Dettman

customer_reviews.title: Great dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Love the measured dispensing, wish it was a little larger.
customer_reviews.author: Jean J.

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not worth it...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to limit the sugar intake of my child. It is fine for that, but it does not hold much and it is overpriced for what it is. I do like the nifty funnel that comes inside the dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! Makes a tremendous mess
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! Makes a tremendous mess. Doesn't dispense evenly like it promises at all.
customer_reviews.author: karen welch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the office.
customer_reviews.text: People are always in awe of this dispenser for some reason. It's a pretty neat little gizmo and it works great. Easy to refill and looks nice out on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: cass_atx

customer_reviews.title: So very handy
customer_reviews.text: I live with some messy people and this solves the problem of having sugar spilled around the coffee area everyday
customer_reviews.author: queencaren

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I’ve used it for a couple weeks. I use it to dispense 1⁄2 tsp sugar in to my cup before I pour hot tea into it. I read other reviewers complain about it clogging if used over steam. I don’t know of any dispenser that works in the presence of steam. I would definitely buy another if anything happened to this one.
customer_reviews.author: mInv55

customer_reviews.title: Handy!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it - she can accurately measure her sugar without digging in the drawer for a spoon. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Copperhead43

customer_reviews.title: Sugar Dispenser is wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this sugar dispenser. It is easy to use & looks great! I've had mine for 3 years and just bought 2 more for friends that were visiting as they also loved it.
customer_reviews.author: AZtoUK

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very pleased only problem was the time it took to arrive in australia
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sugar dispenser
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous purchasing this sugar dispenser because of the previous reviews of it leaking, but it doesn't not leak for me and I love the fact it comes with a funnel so you can easily put sugar into it without the mess.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my coffee drinking husband for Christmas. Works great, have not had any of the issues that other people have claimed. I love fun kitchen stuff and this fills the bill!!!
customer_reviews.author: vicki

customer_reviews.title: Father's Day gift for some one who uses sugar substitue
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these at my house. This was a little Father's Day gift because they envied mine. Big hit
customer_reviews.author: sara ilsley

customer_reviews.title: sugar dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Was happy with my purchase. It was what I wanted and arrived in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R. Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Ok.......so...so
customer_reviews.text: Well made ,holds way to little. Dispensed amount hard to judge and messy. Forget to remove bottomn cap, oh...oh.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Z. Mazurek

customer_reviews.title: Good product, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: i bought this product because my wife has cerebral palsy and has always struggled with spooning sugar into our cups. it worked exactly as stated and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Silva

customer_reviews.title: Prodyne SD-& is a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Its a piece of junk and the sugar keeps leaking out. The funnel keeps falling out of bottom into the coffee etc.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn R.

customer_reviews.title: misdirected
customer_reviews.text: when this product was introduced to me by a search, i was searching for a Powdered Sugar Dispenser and up pops this gadget. i thought it looked nice and easy to use but when i got it - i realized it wasn't a Powdered Sugar Dispenser - it was for regular sugar - - the Powdered Sugar was too thick to be dispensed but i imagine that regular sugar would work just fine. just dont get confused and make sure you know what you are buying when their search engine returns items that have nothing to do with your original search.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great but
customer_reviews.text: The only and big BUT of this product is the amount of sugar it dispense. It is way too much sugar for me so I have to put a spoon underneath it and split the amount into two coffees. If you like sugar it is a great choice but otherwise I would reconsider
customer_reviews.author: Mauri

customer_reviews.title: Great splenda dispenser
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these dispensers, 1 in my home and 1 in our RV. I use them both to dispense my Splenda. I have had the first one for at least 10 years and it is still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Period. Much easier than the sugar bowl, spoon, mess up the counter situation. The little funnel inside the bottom is great, if a little bit difficult to get out for use. I just have this sitting out on the counter next to the stove by my kettle, ready for my tea. It's attractive and so convenient. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AllyOops

customer_reviews.title: No spoons needed. Just a push..button
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Guests get a kick out of discovering how much sugar they use. I wrote 1/2 tsp per push on bottom with a Sharpie, as a reminder. I like that a wet spoon never has to touch the sugar.
customer_reviews.author: N. Peltier

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I had owned one for many years and it finally gave up - my husband missed it and so did I when it came to measuring for a recipe -when I saw this, I ordered immediately - the new one is great and better looking than the old.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Cook

customer_reviews.title: Modern, measured and slick
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can keep it on the counter and it looks modern. It works really well and I have found it keeps me on track for not over-sugaring my coffee ;) My only negative would be that it is on the small side and the opening (top) to refill is narrow. But a funnel solved for that.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboyspals

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I decided to try this for my sugar and creamer. They worked fantastic, no messes and was a big hit with my guests. My grandson uses the sugar one on his cerial and there was not even a small mess to clean. It is a simple concept that works fantasticly. The compartment is a little small, not so much that I would caution against them. My daughter likes it so well she is getting one. As far as fun kitchen gadgets go I give it an A.
customer_reviews.author: taraalutiiq

customer_reviews.title: love it no mess
customer_reviews.text: we've had the traditional diner sugar shaker over the years. My husband loves lots-o-sugar in his coffee and my kids like sugar on their berries sometimes.... the diner one is difficult to screw the lid on because sugar granules get stuck underneath and it's messy when you take lid off. This one is awesome no sugar over the counter when using or filling. really like it and so does the family.
customer_reviews.author: jcard

customer_reviews.title: Inside funnel
customer_reviews.text: My second one. Never knew about the inside funnel to fill it with. Game changer
customer_reviews.author: K.B.

customer_reviews.title: I love this dispenser
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any trouble at all with Splenda sticking and I think people who have complained about leaking from the bottom may have discarded the cap, which is on the bottom. If you put the cap back on every time there is no leakage, I just pop the cap off and tap it on my cup so that the tiny bit of granules sitting in the cap go right in my cup. I dropped my dispenser and broke the top so am purchasing my second one today.
customer_reviews.author: MsSL

customer_reviews.title: Better than my old one
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened it I thought it was too small and thought I'd be refilling often. Well lookie there! It held as much as my old sugar thing! It does the 1/2tsp as it says. Yes - I measured.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great till it broke....
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this dispenser for a few months and really liked it for dispensing setiva instead of having to open little packets. Worked pretty well until it tipped over and the clear plastic part seperated from the bottom. It's useless now. Diappointed it is so flimsy - it was a gentle fall.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: it's pretty to look at but not functional for constant
customer_reviews.text: leaks a little too much to get 5 stars.. it's pretty to look at but not functional for constant use
customer_reviews.author: JennifferR

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like this but it doesn't hold much. It looks nicer next to my coffee maker than my old Tupperware sugar container.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S G

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband as a gift. It's great, but sometimes gets clogged up if not cleaned regularly or dried 100% before putting sugar back in.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi B

customer_reviews.title: Nice but messy
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product but very messy. It leaves sugar granules everywhere. I have to put a place under it at all times which defeats the purpose of having a modern, slick, each dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: BrianK

customer_reviews.title: Good little sugar dispenser
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this. this is my second one i have bought. My first one broke because i dropped it at a bad angle. Ive dropped this one too but it seems to hold up well
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold enough sugar - had to refill too often
customer_reviews.text: This product looks great but if you have a family who uses a lot of sugar in their coffee, you will be refilling this often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it was alright i guess
customer_reviews.text: it was useful but left a lot of sugar residue after you used it even when you put the small cap on afterwards
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: good invention
customer_reviews.text: i bought this about a week ago. i am satisfied. it performs as advertised. i drink several cups of hot tea a day and did not want to have to measure with a teaspoon. it also is compact and stores in a cabinet shelf easily. it does not have a cheap look. 2 thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: pvel

customer_reviews.title: Sugar gets stuck and not consistent
customer_reviews.text: Not the same amount every press of the button and hard to use as sugar gets stuck. Also hard to clean. I've thrown this out and gone to using natural sweetener in a stick packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Dispenser
customer_reviews.text: This dispenser eliminates sugar messes and waste while keeping the sugar dry in a humid environment. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Firth

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to control output
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, but it lacks pour control. Its either full on or off unless you have a super good touch!
customer_reviews.author: Ringo

customer_reviews.title: ok but messy and a little rigid
customer_reviews.text: doesn't completely disperse sugar with one push. after you do, it still makes a little bit of a mess. Pressing the button is a little tough
customer_reviews.author: Norby

customer_reviews.title: Non Functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, hoping to find a more efficient way to put sugar in our company in the morning...I was very disappointed. the steam from the coffee rendered this dispenser useless. The sugar clogged up, and despite our best efforts in pushing the dispenser button, no sugar would come out. I would not recommend this; I would just say stick with the old fashioned sugar bowl...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good...
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty good. It needs the cap on the bottom, but the cap is still a pain. You can leave it off, of course, but someone will inevitably press the button and you'll have sugar on your counter.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen F.

customer_reviews.title: Works. Holds 30 tsp.
customer_reviews.text: If anyone is wondering, the capacity is about 5 ounces (30 tsp or 150ml). So it will dispense 60 times before needing to be refilled. The product details say "Product Dimensions: 7.8 x 3.8 x 2.5 inches ; 8 ounces". This apparently means 8 ounces weight as if anybody cares. Effin A'Merica.
customer_reviews.author: clark

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a sugar dispenser for hot tea which I drink every morning. For this use it is worthless. My dispenser would only deliver about 1/4 to maybe 1/3 tsp. per button push. Thats a lot of button pushing if you like your beverage sweet. But the worst of all is that the steam from hot coffee or tea plugs up the dispenser so badly it would take a hundred button pushes to do the job. I'm giving it to my wife in hopes she can find some spice that can be dispensed in small quantities.
customer_reviews.author: schuh

product_meta.title: Prodyne Sugar Dispenser, One Size
product_meta.description: The push of a button dispenses 1/2 a teaspoon of sugar, which approximates one packet of sugar. Two portions equal a standard sugar cube. May also dispense powdered creamer. Holds 1/4-pound of sugar kept clean and fresh. Made of crystal clear acrylic with stylish brushed chrome accents.
feature_bullets: Made of crystal clear acrylic with stylish brushed chrome accents
Dispenses 1/2 teaspoon of sugar with the push of a button

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars136 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
